Crimes.Crime_Name: Immigration-related offences under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to properly assess new evidence in PRRA application
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) sections 96 and 97
Crimes.Application_Facts: Ms. Behrooznia provided new evidence of post-hearing political involvement
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and remittal for reconsideration
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application granted, case remitted to a different PRRA Officer
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: PRRA Officer dismissed new evidence without adequate consideration
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution due to political involvement
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility and materiality of new evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural fairness in assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: New evidence was credible but not properly assessed
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Documentation of political activities after refugee hearing
Crimes.Governing_Rule: PRRA Officer must consider new, materially different evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Officer failed to distinguish past from new political activities
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to persecution due to political opinion
Crimes.Cause_Description: Officer rejected PRRA citing insufficient new evidence despite submission of post-hearing political involvement
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: New evidence dismissed without proper analysis
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Conflation of prior and new evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evaluation of new political engagement
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Decision unreasonable due to inadequate reasoning on new evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to recognize material change in circumstances

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness and procedural fairness of PRRA decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Some evidence deemed not new or insufficiently credible
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Fraudulent travel documents, claims of persecution based on religion, gender, political involvement
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to religion, gender, and political opinion
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of fraudulent documents and credibility of risk claims
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to properly assess new political involvement evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: New evidence of political involvement post-refugee hearing
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness in administrative decisions
Crimes.Application_Factor: Submission of PRRA with new evidence of risk
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether decision was reasonable and fair
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Case remanded to a different PRRA Officer
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Arrival with fraudulent documents and perceived lack of credible new evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inadequate consideration of new political activity evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to failure to fairly assess new submissions
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Use of fraudulent travel documents upon entry
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Concerns about truthfulness due to document fraud
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of genuine fear of persecution despite document misuse
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada â€“ Federal Court review of immigration decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural fairness in evaluating risk claims
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to consider new evidence separately from prior claims
